note.p: Physician. DM, St Andrews, 1847; MRCS 1847; MRCP 1850. Physician to the hospital for women, Soho Square, London, 1851–7; co-founder and secretary of the Obstetrical Society of London, 1859–63; assistant physician for the diseases of women and children, King’s College Hospital, London, 1860–3. Author of many medical works, including A manual of the practice of medicine (1854).
